page.title: 06RELIGION DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: A gradual decline has occured in attendance at the 2 Methodist chapels.In 1983 the chapel at Minard Cross was closed for regular worship.Downderry has 19 'official' Church members who are presently sponsoring extensive renovations of the building.Finances are good,from event and donation income. Several interdenominational services are organised e.g A Methodist/Anglican Sunday School of 12 children.The annual events like the Harvest of the Sea service,the Harvest Festival and the Candlelight Carol service still fill the chapel to capacity. From 1980 to 85 the chapel had it's first female ordained Minister.This popular cleric,the Rev.Joan Ryland has very recently been replaced ,and an pastoral assistant has been appointed, to work and live locally.
